title: A Property of Geodesics in Special K\"ahler Geometry
abstract:
We study the stable geodesics of the QFT special K\"ahler geometry ($\equiv$
Seiberg-Witten geometry of 4d $\mathcal{N}=2$ QFT) using the Myers argument.
Complete stable geodesics are quite restricted, and can be described very
explicitly. In particular no closed stable geodesic exists. We comment on the
application of the Myers method to related problems, including geodesics in
moduli spaces of Calabi-Yau 3-folds.
